behaviors.desc:
Use `Polymer.IronValidatableBehavior` to implement an element that validates user input.

### Accessiblity

Changing the `invalid` property, either manually or by calling `validate()` will update the
`aria-invalid` attribute.

jsdoc.description:
Use `Polymer.IronValidatableBehavior` to implement an element that validates user input.

### Accessiblity

Changing the `invalid` property, either manually or by calling `validate()` will update the
`aria-invalid` attribute.
jsdoc.orig:
*
   * Use `Polymer.IronValidatableBehavior` to implement an element that validates user input.
   *
   * ### Accessiblity
   *
   * Changing the `invalid` property, either manually or by calling `validate()` will update the
   * `aria-invalid` attribute.
   *
   * @demo demo/index.html
   * @polymerBehavior

properties.name: invalid
properties.desc: True if the last call to `validate` is invalid.

jsdoc.description: True if the last call to `validate` is invalid.
jsdoc.orig:
*
       * True if the last call to `validate` is invalid.

*
     * @param {Object} values Passed to the validator's `validate()` function.
     * @return {boolean} True if `values` is valid.

properties.name: validator
properties.desc: Name of the validator to use.

jsdoc.description: Name of the validator to use.
jsdoc.orig:
*
       * Name of the validator to use.
